source.author: Duretto, M.F.
source.title: Rutaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae
source.citation: From: Duretto, M.F. (1999). Rutaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Leaves pilose to glabrescent; sepals pilose to ciliate, to 3.5 mm long, often with recurved margins; Grampians eastward
Leaves glabrous to glabrescent; sepals glabrous, to 2 mm long, margins not recurved; Little Desert and far south-west
Largest leaves >10 mm long and larger leaflets >9 mm long; petiole 1–3 mm long; far south west only
Largest leaves <10 mm long and larger leaflets <9 mm long; petiole to 1 mm long; Little Desert only
